lead_paragraph: Ten world champions will defend their titles for the United States at the world championships in Osaka, Japan, beginning Aug. 25.American athletes won a record 14 gold medals at the 2005 worlds in Helsinki, Finland, their overall medal haul of 25 matching their total from the 2004 Olympics.Headlining the American team are Jeremy Wariner, the defending champion in the 400 meters who has the world’s fastest time this year, and Allyson Felix, who won the 200 title in 2005 and has the world’s best time in the event this year.Also on the team are Tyson Gay (100 and 200) and Lauryn Williams (100); Breaux Greer, who has the world’s best javelin throw in 2007; Alan Webb, who set the American record in the mile last month and will run the 1,500; Adam Nelson, who won gold in the shot-put at the 2005 worlds and has top throw this year; Michelle Perry, the reigning world champion in the 100 hurdles; Brad Walker in the pole vault; and Reese Hoffa in the shot-put.
